Package com.xebisco.yield.physics

Schnittstelle ContactListener

ContactAdapter
public interface ContactListener

  • Methodendetails

    • onContactBegin

      void onContactBegin(Collider collider, Collider colliding)
      This is a function that is called when two colliders begin to make contact.
      Parameter:
      collider - The first parameter "collider" is an object that represents the collider that this method is being called on.
      colliding - The "colliding" parameter in the method signature refers to the collider that the first collider (represented by the "collider" parameter) has made contact with. In other words, it is the collider that is colliding with the first collider.

    • onContactEnd

      void onContactEnd(Collider collider, Collider colliding)
      This is a function that is called when two colliders stop colliding.
      Parameter:
      collider - The first parameter "collider" is an object that represents the collider that the current object is attached to.
      colliding - The colliding parameter is a reference to the collider that the collider parameter is no longer in contact with. In other words, it represents the collider that the onContactEnd event is being triggered for.

    • preSolve

      void preSolve(org.jbox2d.dynamics.contacts.Contact var1, org.jbox2d.collision.Manifold var2)
      The preSolve function is a method used to handle contact and manifold information before a collision occurs.
      Parameter:
      var1 - The first parameter, var1, is of type Contact and represents the contact point between two colliding objects. It contains information about the collision such as the two objects involved, the point of contact, and the normal vector of the collision.
      var2 - The var2 parameter in the preSolve method is a Manifold object that represents the contact manifold between two colliding bodies. The manifold contains information about the contact points, normal vector, and other properties of the collision.

    • postSolve

      void postSolve(org.jbox2d.dynamics.contacts.Contact var1, org.jbox2d.callbacks.ContactImpulse var2)
      The postSolve function is a method used to handle contact information after a collision occurs.
      Parameter:
      var1 - The first parameter, var1, is a Contact object that represents the collision between two physics bodies. It contains information such as the two bodies involved in the collision, the point of contact, and the normal vector of the collision.
      var2 - The var2 parameter in the postSolve method is an object of the ContactImpulse class. It contains information about the impulses generated by the collision between two bodies in the physics simulation. This information can be used to calculate the amount of force applied during the collision and to determine the resulting motion of
